title: Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown
subhead: Videos, uploaded to social media despite the internet shutdown in Iran, show a vast number of corpses piled up in the forensic center's warehouse and lined up in the yard. Witnesses corroborated the footage to Le Monde.

title: French PM Lecornu faces backlash after threatening snap elections
Fed chair Powell says he is under federal investigation
Israel revokes French historian Vincent Lemire's travel permit
subhead: Lemire specializes in the history of Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories and was head of the French Research Center in Jerusalem from 2019 to August 2023.

title: Cuba's economy and stability are shaken by the Venezuela crisis
subhead: The fall of Nicolas Maduro threatens to deprive Havana of its main ally, Venezuela, which accounted for 10% of Cuba's trade in 2025. Despite support from Mexico and China, the island nation could see its economic – and social – crisis worsen dramatically.

title: Exclusive images: On the set of 'Marty Supreme,' Timothée Chalamet dominates the game
subhead: In 'Marty Supreme,' directed by Josh Safdie, Timothée Chalamet plays Marty Mauser, a character inspired by the 1950s table tennis star Marty Reisman. With a Golden Globe win, the role cements the 30-year-old as one of the greatest actors of his generation. Photographer Tim El Kaïm had exclusive access to the set of this highly anticipated film, which is set for release in France in February.

title: Quinn Slobodian: 'The US discarding the post-1945 international system is a bold and reckless gamble'
subhead: The Trump administration stubbornly believes that the only way for the US to regain its lost greatness is through regional, rather than global, supremacy, analyzes the specialist in global history.

title: Trump's brute force will not drive China out of Latin America

French Alps avalanches kill at least six skiers
In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
RN voters prefer Bardella over Le Pen, according to poll
subhead: The victimization strategy that Marine Le Pen, head of the far-right Rassemblement National party, adopted after her embezzlement conviction has failed to reach beyond her core base. Her party's voters see Jordan Bardella as more capable of leading France.

title: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
subhead: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.

title: 2027 French presidential election: A real campaign is needed to slow the far right
By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
